translation: Know, O Arjuna, that Rajas is of the nature of passion, the source of thirst and attachment; it binds fast the embodied one by attachment to action.
commentary: 14.7 Rajas Rajas? Ragatmakam of the nature of passion? Viddhi know? the source of thirst and attachment? That that? Deals with binds? Kaunteya O son of Kunti (Arjuna)? Karmasangana by attachment to action? Dehinam the embodied one.Commentary The ality of Rajas denotes activity and ambition. The Rajasic man is full of cravings and desires. The cravings force him to act for their fulfillment.
